The "unlocked" version is a Skidrow release.  They always put out a Steam version first and then try to get the crack out for it ASAP.  The problem is when they claim things like "FULL UNLOCKED" which would mean that it is cracked or comes with a crack.  They promised the same thing with Diablo III and it never came, for a good reason.

According to the reports above, this torrent is dead.  It will never work.  It does not install to the registry, so the game will not operate on your system.

The "FULL UNLOCKED" version will *probably* work once the crack is released.  Until then, we cannot be 100% sure.
They are the same.

How is it possible for two releases with different sizes to be the same contents? Different archival methods is possible, but this says Multi9 where the other says Multi7. So I would wager either the 9 is incorrect, the 7 is incorrect or even both are incorrect.

Neither of them is Multi anything because neither is coming from a DVD. They are both packed archives of a Steam downloads. There are tiny variations in the unpacked archives so if you have one or the other, dont bother with the other because the diffrences, are just things like one still has the installscript (which isnt really used after this), left in the folder and stuff like that.
The unarchived game files are the same size in both torrents.

Again, to make it work with WinXP you need a custom DLL that have a missing functions. Search for zernel32.dll, and check russian forums for a modified steam_api.dll specifically for this crack, because that modified dll also requires functions that not present into zernel32.dll. Simple as that. Gofor it, it works.
